sen.j: 道昭（どうしょう、弘安4年（1281年）-文和4年12月22日 (旧暦)（1356年1月24日））は、天台宗の僧侶、歌人である。
sen.e: Dosho (1281 ~ January 24, 1356) is a priest of Tendai Sect and a poet.
Dosho (1281 - January 24, 1356) was a poet and a priest of the Tendai sect.

sen.j: 弘安4年（1281年）前摂政左大臣一条家経の子として出生。
sen.e: He was born as a child of former Sessho (Regent) and Sadaijin (Minister of the Left), Ietsune ICHIJO in 1281.

sen.j: 兄弟に一条内実、一条冬実、権僧正慈深、大僧正経厳、大僧正良慶などがいる。
sen.e: Among his brothers are Uchizane ICHIJO, Nakasane ICHIJO, Gon no sojo (a highest ranking priest, next to a sojo) Jishin and Daisojo (a Buddhist priest of the highest order) Kyogon and Daisojo Ryokei, etc.

sen.j: 天台宗常住院門跡行昭の弟子となり、叔父でもあった慈昭の後を受けて常住院門跡となる。
sen.e: He became a disciple of Tendai Sect Joju-in Temple's monzeki (in this case, a successor of a temple who is a member of the Imperial family) Gyosho, and succeeded after his uncle, Jisho, the monzeki of Joju-in Temple.
sen.cmt: 「行昭」の読みが確認できなかったためGyoshoとしています。「慈昭」の読みが確認できなかったためJishoとしています。

sen.j: 園城寺長吏、准后、四天王寺別当等を歴任した。
sen.e: He was consecutively Chori (chief priest) of Onjo-ji Temple, Jugo (honorary rank next to the three Empresses: Great Empress Dowager, Empress Dowager, and Empress) and the steward of Shitenno-ji Temple, etc.

sen.j: 一方で『公衡公記』（西園寺公衡の日記）に恒明親王出生の際に御験者として登場しているように護持僧も務めた。
sen.e: In the meantime, as he was described as appeared as "gyogensha", when Imperial Prince Tsuneaki was born, in "Kinhira Koki Diary" (Diary of Kinhira SAIONJI), he also acted as gojiso (a priest who prays to guard the emperor).
sen.cmt: 「御験者」の読みも意味も確認できなかったため、仮にGyogenshaとしています。
sen.e: In the meantime, as he was described as having appeared as "gyogensha" when Imperial Prince Tsuneaki was born, in "Kinhira Koki Diary" (the diary of Kinhira SAIONJI), he also acted as gojiso (a priest who prays for the security of the emperor).

In the meantime, as he was described as having appeared as Ongenjya (mountaineering ascetic) when Imperial Prince Tsuneaki was born, in "Kinhira Koki Diary" (the diary of Kinhira SAIONJI), he also acted as gojiso (a priest who prays for the security of the emperor).

sen.j: また、延慶 (日本)元年（1308年）から元亨元年（1321年）及び元亨3年（1323年）から文和4年（1355年）にかけては、熊野三山検校及び新熊野検校を務めている。
sen.e: Further, he worked Kumano sanzan Kengyo and shin-Kumano sanzan Kengyo (whole responsible person for three holy places in Kumano and shin kumano) from 1308 to 1321, and from 1323 to 1355.

Further, he worked Kumano sanzan Kengyo and shin-Kumano sanzan Kengyo (being the solely responsible person for three holy places in Kumano and Shin-kumano) from 1308 to 1321, and again from 1323 to 1355.

Further, he worked Kumano Sanzan Kengyo (a supervisor of the three shrines in Kumano region) and Ima Kumano Kengyo (a supervisor of Ima Kumano-jinja Shrine) from 1308 to 1321, and again from 1323 to 1355.

sen.j: 最後は大僧正となり、文和4年12月22日（1356年1月24日）死去。
sen.e: He finally became a Daisojo, and died on January 24, 1356.
